This movie was so bad. So much worse than the other 2. Now the truck is supernatural along with his homing bombs and homing spear. Don't watch this. Just take my advice and don't watch it. There is a reason it premiered on Syfy. So much of this movie made me mad. So many things didn't make sense a long with things never being explained which were suppose to be a big reveal in the movie. What did I just put myself through watching this garbage.

Sheriff Sergeant is wearing chevrons AND Major pins....cant be both. Not to mention the amount of officers present he would have been a Captain considering that was way more officers to rural county surroundings ratio. That would have been the Sheriff dept, local county seat dept, amd probably neighboring county depts (again none would be wearing the same exact uniform color). Obviously they didn't ask or pay local LEO's for literally 5 minutes of time.The son who bearied the hand, when he shoots it before burying it, he uses a repeater rifle and never cycles the repeater to load the next round, he shot it three times.The vulcan cannon is way too obvious in its welds that it doesnt mechanically cycle correctly when engaged. Also obviously mild steel construction, which really lends to it being a major fake. The barrels never rotate when used in the movie.Every time the creature stabbed someone, they used a sound effect of two swords clashing..The CB radio used by the hunting team requires a whip antenna on that truck. No antenna.Sherriff Sergeant/Major uses a mini 14 to try and pop rubber tires and the rounds bounce off.....really.Sheriff Sergeant/Major uses a novice grip, but weaver stance is appropriate for his age.Couldnt watch with any seriousness due to all these major flaws.

Now the first one was good, the 2nd one left me wondering "Why?" The 3rd one was what I expected so I wasn't very depressed when I got into it. Really what was the point though. It was like reviving the dead horse than killing it again. I'm not going to waste much time on this. If you want just senseless killing, and not really any kind of story this is a good one time watch. If you're looking for the next great horror flick, don't waste your time. I was at least hoping that it would add something to the franchise, but instead I found myself fighting to stay interested in it. Like my wife, and I agreed it was OK, wouldn't watch it again.

reviews.review_title: Not up to the mark as the previous one....But Okay!
reviews.content: Good one .......But slightly boring at some point..... Full points for the Action Sequences......Great !

reviews.review_title: Was a good movie and can't wait for the 4th one.
reviews.content: I waited so many years for part 3 and glad they made. I know a lot people are disappointed because so many things were left out which I agree there was. Which is also why there's going to be another one and I hope they finally tell us about the Creeper's origin and how it came to be.

Jeepers Creepers works. It drags on too long and has way too many moments where the characters stand around and do nothing when they should be running, but it has some good atmosphere, introduces the creature well enough, and builds to an ending where the creature gets what it wants and flies away.Jeepers Creepers 2 also works. The title doesn't really make sense anymore because that only had solid meaning in the first film, but it's a logical continuation of the story. Everything to do with Ray Wise's character is fun and the film leads up to the end of the creature's 23-day feeding period. We actually see how it goes dormant and get a little more insight into how the creature works. I have gripes with the character development and the corny moment where he eats a guy's head, but overall, it's an entertaining movie with better pacing than the first one. It's not as good as the first, but it's more fun, so I feel like the first two movies are about even but I enjoy the second one more.Then comes Jeepers Creepers 3. The first film feels like an introduction, the second feels like a conclusion, then this one feels like... wasting time for no reason in between part 1 and 2. It takes place in the few days between the first two movies and doesn't really bring anything new to the table, even though it repeatedly feels like it's trying to. (More on that later.)The creature uses its ax and truck again, which were missing from the second movie. It was nice to see those again. It was also cool that the truck was developed more... but some of the revelations about the truck were corny. I especially hated the little car-seeking bombs that rolled out of it.There was also a lot going on in the daylight. The first two movies had more action at night, which was more moody, but this could have been a budgetary issue.Most of the effects and cinematography were fine. For the budget, I thought it was a pretty good looking movie. I had really low expectations and was surprised at how decent it looked. There were a few shitty effects shots though. There were only three brief effects that particularly bugged me, but they hurt the movie quite a bit.My biggest issue is that the whole movie ended up feeling completely pointless. Having it set in between the first two movies meant that it couldn't show the end of it's 23-day feed and it couldn't be killed. There wasn't even really a major finale. It basically just ends without any reason. The creature just vanishes and the characters say "I heard it's gone now. Won't be back for 23 springs." "Oh, that's good." WHY? Why would it be gone? Why would they have reason to think it's gone?As for the movie's major "reveals/twists":SPOILERS1. One of the main characters from this movie ended up on the bus from the second movie. Okay? Well he obviously wasn't IN the second movie. That wouldn't make sense if he was. All of the athletes on the bus in the second film had no idea what the creature was or what was going on. If he was on that bus, you'd think he would have spoken up. So he must have gotten off and stayed at their destination. (Apparently he mutters some throwaway dialogue that confirms this, but I missed it.) Then what are the implications of showing that he was on that bus? ABSOLUTELY NOTHING! It's just "Hey, remember that bus from the other movie? Well, this character was on that bus one time." SO FUCKING WHAT??? Does this mean he lead to creeper toward the bus or something? This reveal just doesn't appear to add anything to the story or change it in any way. It feels totally pointless and stupid. It comes off like a big revelation, but it's more like an Easter egg that was splattered in your face as opposed to hidden. MAYBE his involvement with the team could serve some purpose in part 4, but I struggle to imagine what such a purpose could be.2. The creature's hand got cut off in 1978 and if you touch it, you learn what the creature is. Ooooh, enticing. So what is it? What do they learn? They learn that "it's an ancient thing." Oh. Okay? We already knew that from previous movies? So are there any other implications here? Do they learn how to kill it or something? If so, they don't really say it. They just "learn what it is" and then they leave a sign for it saying "We know what you are." So fucking what? What are the grand implications of them knowing what it is? They never give any new information to the audience and their knowledge doesn't seem to have any bearing on the story. But still, the creeper seems very upset by this sign and falls to its knees and roars as all of the crows die around it. (That scene was actually pretty cool, but I still don't get how it affected the story in any way at all.) This seems to be the only thing that provoked the creature to fly away at the end of the movie. It's clearly scared that they can hurt it with the information they got, I guess. So this "big revelation" is something that won't be revealed until the next movie if it even happens. This tiny little concept is the only part of this movie that hinted at serving a purpose, and I feel like they could have just introduced it and followed through on it in the same movie instead of just trying to drag the series out longer.3. In a tacked-on ending scene that wasn't built up to in any way, we suddenly see Trish from the first film. She's putting out a call to arms and announcing that when the creature comes back in 2024, she's going to kill it once and for all. WELL THERE'S YOUR FUCKING STORY! Why didn't you tell THAT story for part 3? The final ending to the creature would actually carry some weight and affect the damn story. But no, instead, you just chose to waste our fucking time meandering in between part 1 and 2. Thanks.END SPOILERSOverall, the movie was underwhelming and it filled a gap that nobody asked to be filled. It did so without bringing any worthwhile information to the table or doing anything significant for the story of the series. This would all be fine for a slasher film if it were at least entertainingly gruesome, but it doesn't really hit the spot there either.The way Salva wrote this one just seems to be a big set up for the next one. He should have just blown his load and finished the series with this third movie, because the whole film industry is trying to distance themselves from him for his pedophilia and I'll be surprised if he manages to get part 4 off the ground. I've been interested enough in the series to watch them all, but I don't feel the need to own them. I'll give part 4 a rent if it happens.And to ease my conscience over giving money to Victor Salva, I made a donation to his victim, who is trying to fund a tour to raise awareness of sexual abuse and help other victims. I recommend that the high & mighty keyboard warriors who condemn Jeepers Creepers fans shut up and do the same: https://www.gofundme.com/we-r-their-voiceJeepers Creepers - 5/10
Jeepers Creepers 2 - 6/10
Jeepers Creepers 3 - 4/10

Why do this?There was some much going for Jeepers Creepers at the end of the second film. The first was also really good. But this, this is a CGI mass, they had a great opportunity to expend the lore but no, they f**d that up to. And how dose CGI from 2003 look better than from 2017 and from the same franchise. This killed the franchise.

They messed up the entire storyline.

And not in a good way like some low budget indie movies look good. the acting is corny and cringy. The creeper isn't even scary in this one. reviews.review_title: Jeepers Creepers Franchise Is Now Dead
reviews.content: The director Salva should never be allowed to set foot on a film set again after this absolute car crash.To have single handily destroyed what was an amazing franchise takes a special kind of moron.I have never seen such a horrifically bad attempt at a film in recent years and that's saying something as I had to sit through Dunkirk this summer! The Creeper is finished, it was as if they deliberately set out to destroy the character.Don't pay to watch this crap just download for free on any site, no-one deserves to profit from this.

The actors are terrible, the script is lazy, the dialogues are terrible and the villain is completely out of character. I was offended by this movie! I just made the account to post how bad this was.

reviews.review_title: I mean.....Holy Crap man.....One of the worst movies out there.
reviews.content: I have been waiting for this movie for a long time and when it's finally here it has ruined all the excitement that was there before. The first 15 minutes of the movie are more than enough to give you a hint to not waste your time on this complete piece of garbage. Although i still watched the movie hoping that maybe it will get better which never happened. It just got bad and bad and bad. There's nothing good about the movie and i literally mean nothing. First there's no plot, they even managed to mess up a straightforward story line. Second, the events happening in the movie made no sense whatsoever. It simply looked like they were trying to combine various random events. Third, the acting of the characters is very bad. Given what was happening in the movie, it had some of the most bullshit dialogues and expressions i have ever seen. Fourth, the representation of the creature in this movie is the worst in the series. Since, when did it needs all those weapons, it's like all of a sudden it has become modern. Simply took away the originality of the creature. The least they could have done is to give us some closure about the origins of the creature but again that never happens.So my advise to you is to just stay away from this. Only see it if you are interested in seeing a movie that's a contender for one of the worst movies of the year or maybe of all times.

I loved the first two Jeepers Creepers movies. They were suspenseful and fun. This mess however was a total letdown. The plot, what there was of it, was a jumbled incoherent [mess]. The "main character" Addison sleepwalked through the movie. Stan Shaw's character chewed so much scenery that the rest of the actors had no solid ground to stand on, not that it matters since they were apparently given no direction and just stood around looking confused. Meg Foster was about the only decent thing in the movie and that's disappointing since the Creeper is the namesake. This go around he was a complete joke. He wasn't menacing or scary like he was in the first two films. Salva and co completely neutered his character in favor of giving more attention to his truck which is somehow an indestructable tank including tires that can't be pierced by bullets. Go figure. I was really looking forward to seeing Trish again and how they would include her but alas she only gets a small cameo before the credits roll. The CGI was laughably bad, like The Scorpion King with The Rock bad. I kept wondering if The Asylum or The SyFy channel had an uncredited hand in the production of this junk. If you're a fan of this series stick with the first two.
It really is not good. I know sometimes you have to be in a horror film mood to watch this guy of film, but even when you're in such a mood, you'll be disappointed by the poor acting and story.

If you are a fan of the previous Jeeper Creeper movies, do your self a favor and stay away from this film. As someone who would rate the first 2 films as 9/10, this film just suck to be frank, it was so bad I couldn't even finish it. It fails on all ends, poor acting, horrible plot and outrageous Choreography, it was an utter disappointment to what was an amazing story. This marks the official death or the franchise, or the start to a line of poor low budget films.

reviews.review_title: Only good thing is Chester Rushing
reviews.content:
This was not good enough for me Not at all because the creeper is too angry and has lost the charm 
this monster had in the frist and secound movie Chester Rushing is a good actor and does the best he can 
and some of the other youngsters are okey but the story 
is not what i wanted why did they not start where the secound ended whit Ray Wise from Twin peaks the end here was really crap in all way

I have seen 2 parts of Jeepers creepers. They were good but this third part of the movie made me disappointed. What exactly lead character wanted to do and in what manners, really didn't. Anyway in my view point this movie doesn't come in actual horror genre even its a thriller action film.

reviews.review_title: The Creeper is an Horror Version of Superman
reviews.content: Victor Salva did well in the first two installments of Jeepers Creepers. And he messed up with this third film. What's with the special effects? It's like it was degraded. There are redundant scenes and some scenes were also unexplained. The part where they touched the dismembered Creeper's hand, you thought they already know the secrets to killing the Creeper but in the end, they didn't.Lastly, I read somewhere, they're writing and going to release a sequel. I suggest if they don't have the budget, don't repeat what they did in this third Jeepers Creepers film. They're just going to ruin it again. Perhaps, make the 4th film the last.Thanks!

Literally the worst movie I have ever seen. The acting, CGI, and whole movie in general are cringe worthy. I'm a huge fan of Jeepers Creepers 1 but this is just ridiculous. It looks like a couple college students with $20,000 budget made this movie. I waited years for part 3 to come out, totally disappointing.

What was this? Was this a fever dream? Did this movie really happen? I'm legitimately questioning reality right now. I'm not sure if this was a joke or a genuine attempt at making a horror film. Either way it was awful. I would rather watch The Room 36 times in one sitting than watch this monstrosity again. If you plan on seeing this then I recommend skipping it and eating sawdust instead.

Why?! JC1 is probably one of my favourite horror films of all time. JC2 was OK - probably made better as it was shot quite well. So JC3!!! So excited when i heard it was being remade, it felt like an age before i saw the posters that it was being released. So the credits roll - wait, is this a TV Movie? Give it ten mins, surely the acting will get better - Gina Phillips will be back in it soon and we will have a good storyline and decent acting. Gina? Gina???? nope, no Gina, ah there you are for ten seconds!Stereotypical characters fill the movie, the creeper suddenly has an inspector gadget style truck - the old school fearful monster scares have been replaced by a truck that has been made by Macauley caulking circa 1993. Oh and one thing that is very strange. It us shot in DAYLIGHT! the cinematography is terrible also, the music is right from the hallmark channel. Yeah, disappointed and also angry that a movie franchise that so many people love has been ruined by this 90 minutes of absolute dross.

reviews.review_title: Worst of the Installments by far!
reviews.content: What a waste!!! I was so eagerly waiting for this installment!! Comparing to the other two, this movie is like a grade C movie! Complete waste of time! Please watch if you prefer comical reactions and bad acting! Stupid Cast, Crappy story, Bad action sequences in this era of VFX!!! Guys....you have ruined the excitement of Jeepers Creepers!!!!!!!

I wish I can go back in time just to un see this movie. I hated pretty much everything about this movie. I hate how "new" and "human" the Creeper looks. If he comes around every 23 years he's not suppose to look younger then what he did in the 1st movie since this one storyline takes place inbeteeen the 1st and 2nd storyline which was also a bad idea.

That was one of the worst horror movies that i have seen so far , the story was awful and the computer effects were disaster they were made by very nonprofessional team The cast were bunch of non actors trying to be actors. It was a very low budget movie , and was a bad mistake to continue with the sequence They should have stopped the production at the second movie

This movie seemed rushed and they tried so hard to get so many things into it that they left many things open and unanswered. The movie just ended without any closure. Sheriff Tashtego and Gaylon Brandon both touched the hand of the Creeper that had been cut off in the past. Supposedly that showed them what the Creeper was, how it was created, and possibly how someone could kill it. The movie never told us how it was created, which probably would have been a better premise for a movie that this wast of time, never said what it was, and never said how it could be possibly killed. Sheriff Tashtego ends up shooting the Creeper with a gatling gun that they planned to use since the beginning of the movie. That doesn't kill the Creeper which leads to the question why did he touch the hand if he was going to try and shoot the Creeper anyway. The movie never mentions how long the Creeper has been loose just that it gets turned loose for 23 days. Through most of the movie there is a big focus on the Creeper needing to go the farm to get his hand and kill anyone there. When he finally does make it back to the farm, there is a note on the ground stating "We know what your are" with the hand on top of the not with a nail through it. The Creeper yells and then the movie just ends. "We know what you are", but were not going to tell anyone else apparently. The special effects were nothing to brag about, the acting was mediocre, and the movie for the most part was boring. If anyone watches cinema sins, and they do this movie, it would be worth watching cause it will be thoroughly torn apart. As it should be. Maybe they should make the next installment in like 3 years, cause 14 seemed give the writers to much time to think about what they wanted in the movie so they just put a little pieces of a ton of ideas and decided not to complete any of them.

I was so excited when I saw the film was coming out. I actually enjoyed JC1 and 2. I've watched both a few times and even though 2 was a bit crap, I got into the spirit of the film.My husband and I sat down, elated we're finally getting to see it, and within the first 3 minutes we were like hmm when is this suppose to be? After the first one? We thought that couldn't be right since there was already a JC2? The more we watched, the more confused we got as to when this was suppose to fit in to some time line. IT NEVER DID!!! It was an utter disappointment. My husband said lets pretend they didn't do a JC 3 and forget about the series. He's right, such a pity.They could have take this into something so fantastic but they blew it big time!

reviews.review_title: A disgrace compared to the first two films
reviews.content: I really enjoyed jeepers creepers 1 & 2 but this film is a disgrace and utter disappointment. The script, the suspense and the plot just isn't there. I do not like to give bad reviews unless deserved but this is one film to miss. Lacked fun and enjoyment and it was just a shambles from the start.

reviews.review_title: Fans stay away, everyone stay away
reviews.content: I'll keep this brief. I know this series isn't the best but I enjoyed the original quite a bit. It felt fresh and the creeper looked amazing especially the way they lit him and kept him mostly in Misty shadows. The second movie was merely ok and had lots of bad acting.THIS MOVIE is a genuine insult to not only fans of the series but general audiences as well. The writing is beyond awful as is the acting. The effects are worse than ever, everything just looks cheap and the story is god awful. They don't even follow their own rules or established timeline.I won't spoil anything but there is supposed to be this reveal and...it's just beyond stupid and completely pointless. It actually detracts from the movie despite giving no new information about the character.Just don't watch it. Trust me...it's not so bad it's good, it's not anything but bad and if you are a fan of the series you will be dumbfounded by how utterly horrible this movie is. Worst of all it makes no sense because it was written directed and produced by the same guy who did the 1st 2 movies so how he managed to so royally ruin a great new movie monster is beyond all comprehension.

I grew up with the JC series and I have to say that this was horrible. Cheap, bad acting...you name it. The movie seemed as though it was shot in one day. Jeepers Creepers hunting still changes incredibly with him hunting in broad daylight...and that red shirt just threw me off...The CGI was horrible, which led me to believe that this movie was either made for the Syfy channel or straight to DVD release only. I feel bad for anyone that went to see this in theaters...I saw it online. I was so happy and waited so long just to be disappointed... Oh yeah...the story line sucked, the characters dropped off the face of the planet and there was no development for them...and the movie was an overall bore. I'm not even sure when this movie takes place...is it in between the first and the second...or does it come after the second one? Where are the characters from the second one? Where is the guy that was waiting for JC to wake up? I'm so confused....and how come I still know nothing about JC or his past...?

reviews.review_title: Jeepers Creepers 3 is not so good
reviews.content: Not too impressed with part 3 of the "Jeepers Creepers" movie series especially after making us wait 15 years for a 3rd sequel when we were ready for one way back then when it was still fresh in all of our minds. I felt a little lost at first also after not seeing the other films for so many years. It just somehow seemed more silly and less scary than the other two movies. Nothing good enough in it to even make me want to watch it again. The Creeper was far less mysterious than in the past films and was just sort of out there all the time killing everybody compared to the previous movies where he made fewer but far more memorable and scary appearances . Maybe it was because the low budget or just poor writing this time?

Why I ask. How does a director make previous 2 movies which I FOUND FANTASTIC and then does this one. Lack of money? Lack of desire? 
Script placed the movie between the previous two which then did little to make characters defined as to who, what, when etc. Since I have seen the previous two many times(have the movies on dvd), I found myself confused on who these characters were to one another and the story. To sum up, you will be disappointed in this release and I can honestly say I would not be looking forward to JC4 if done by this director. Very sorry in what was made.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everybody want to make you believe!
reviews.content:
First off all, people who have this movie 1 star really don't know shit about movies really. Most seem so frustated about this movie because it wasnt the movie they wanted it to be, but common 1 star? Never saw Dracula 3000 or House of the Dead?
Oke the movie was the least fun in the trilogy but had smaller budget and did go straight to video. I had fun with it and liked some new stuff about the truck we didnt saw in the other 2. To all 1 star haters, stop watching movies and search something else. 6 stars

Such a disappointment since the first two were so good! Terrible acting, laughable dialogue, just horrible. I can't even find words to describe how awful this movie was. None of the cool campiness of the first two movies, nothing scary. Just a hot stinking mess. Don't waste your time. Didn't really watch the end of it. Hopefully they killed it so there is no danger of making Jeepers Creepers 4.

reviews.review_title: How can this be allowed to happen?
reviews.content:
I can't believe this is from the same director. Completely ruined the franchise. This Reddit post describes it perfectly:
The pacing is excruciatingly slow, dialogues are unnatural, ridiculous, pointless, random and go totally nowhere. It feels like they didn't have a script at all and everyone is just improvising very badly and was forced to keep going until someone said "uh, cut... I guess?". The acting is equally terrible.The movie isn't cohesive whatsoever, it's an absolute mess. The whole movie I never really had an idea who the characters were and absolutely didn't care. It's pretty bad if you only care about the horse. In hindsight the movie doesn't even really seem to be about the creeper as he has almost no screen time. The main character in this movie is his truck as it was painfully obvious they had no budget for special effects so they had to keep the creeper on the ground. When special effects were used it looked like it was done with Windows movie maker or something.We were promised a backstory, but were given some high school parody project about a hobo driving around in an old truck. I have absolutely nothing good to say about this disaster. Or wait, the creeper's mask was still pretty cool.

reviews.review_title: Don't bother unless you struggle to sleep.
reviews.content: If you struggle with insomnia, watch this movie, you will fall to sleep fast. It is utter cheese, poor acting sand a poor story. I liked the first Jeepers Creepers, the second was OK, this is horrendous. It's not like my expectations were high or I was desperately waiting for this movie, it was just plain and simple $hit. Don't waste your time.
Horrible acting, low budget special effects, reminds me of a cheap 1980s tv series. The fade out editing between shots, adds to the terrible overall quality.
Worst movie EVER! I loved part 2, but part three just blew!

reviews.review_title: Best Vintage country Horror film available in Hollywood
reviews.content: Now, those people who are complaining about the CGI, none of you have real taste in horror films. Jeepers creepers story line is 10 out of 10. Yeah I know it's 2017, you guys are so into CGI things, man now look at The underworld movie series, Resident evil series... They have good CGI and they are crap. Everything about this movie has an old school taste, and I bet this Was not shot in recent years. This is a fine excellent movie stop complaining about CGI.

reviews.review_title: Gives away too much about the killer, his tools and mythology.
reviews.content: Info is important. If you give away too much however, you end up with this horrid film.

Okay, first of all its not that bad- it's NOT great either, but let's look at what it is before we get too judgemental.
-Its an above average sequel in a slightly above average horror franchise. We are not dealing with the horror greats here;Steven Speilberg, Tobe Hooper, Romero or Carpenter are not involved. 
The acting is not great, far from it but based on the mount of direct to dvd garbage that relies on community theater grade acting and half-assed CGI this flick fairs better. Barely. The plot seems to be the weak point; please stop with the half-assed attempts at humor e.g. the finger wagging no-no as he takes the tow truck driver.And what exactly was the purpose of the Addison character? I could have done without here completely and her would be lover.
Take the movie as what it is, enjoy the few bright spots and have a giggle at the silly ones.

Why all the hate?? I can't understand it. The cinematography is great, the characters are consistent, AND - yes, it gave me the creeps!And by the way, YES, I watched the first two movies.This must be a hardcore-fan-expectation-thing or or something like that.

reviews.review_title: Only good thing was the ending
reviews.content: The whole movie was cheesy and very badly made, the action scenes put 0 time into, we are suppose to learn about The Creeper's past from the psychic but we don't even get to see that, the movie was very low budget, I loved the first movie, 2nd movie was OK could have been better, this movie ruined everything, spoilers for the ending, the only good thing about the movie was Trish Jenner (Gina Philips) showing up again but for like 5 seconds =(

I love the moments when the creature pauses and floats in the air. I love jeepers creepers. Make more jeepers creepers movies. They are great especially when you are super bored. I love the way he dresses and he is really scary with magic powers.

SpoilersThis film feels like an long introduction for another movie. As a stand alone it offers little, the film doesn't add to mythology in any way. The characters even tease "we know what you are", then don't add any new information about the creeper. So what do we know? We know he has a pimped out van, that seems to have a mind of its own. This van is kinda funny, it even spikes its owner. It would seem more fitting for an evil Inspector Gadget then a supernatural entity. Jeepers Creepers shouldn't be funny or gimmicky, the first film was creepy. It was a chase movie, if the creeper wanted you then you were already dead. The Jeepers song (noticeably absent) should fill you with dread. Was the song too expensive? That money wasn't spent on CGI or on a good script clearly. It's disappointing that this film was clearly rushed because i have looked forward to this movie for years

I you liked (or loved like myself) the first two movies of the Jeepers Creepers franchise , please, let this one go by!!!
Trust me.
First two movies were filmed on a very very higher level and a lot more work was put in making them then this one.
Why for the love of god was it necessary to suddenly make everything about the Creeper "magical"??? There was none of it in the first two movies. But now he can retreive objects "Jedi style" In previous movies he was really mysterious, creepy and scary...but here not anymore. Even tho Jonathan Breck still played him very well. And lets not forget that his truck has a mind of its own!!! Why was this necessary?!?!?!
The whole storyline of this movie feels like somebody really needed to put some events between the first and the second movie...no matter what the consequences would be. Result of it is a bunch of events that form no solid story.
I think they should have finished this franchise after the second movie. And if they are really thinking of making the fourth one....please don't!!!! Especially if they intend to put the same amount of effort in it like they did in this one.
The only positive aspect of movie for me was that the actors from the last movies played their roles in this one too. 
To conclude...first two movie were amazing, third one...we could live without.

I must join the chorus of sane people with regard to this film. It is disappointingly terrible; in every way.If the money was not available to at least make it as good as the first two, it should not have been made at all.I almost have to believe it's lameness was deliberate. I can think of no other explanation besides insanity.

So, as a horror movie this is a 2/10. But as a comedy I'd rate it 8/10. There are some really funny highlights:Tubbs as a crack marksman. The scene when he's hanging out the car window trying to shoot out the tyres of the Creeper's van - not only are his hands shaking like he's got the DTs but he is holding the gun in a very dubious manner.The Creeper's shuriken hits Tubb's shotgun square on the barrel, bending the metal like a peeled banana. I have only seen such things before in cartoons. I was literally shaking with laughter for about ten minutes.The moment when Tubbs attempts to "run away", although one can only use the term "run" in the very loosest of fashions. I'll admit it, I nearly soiled myself I was laughing so much.Creeper wardrobe malfunction - or should I say wing malfunction. OMG, one of the funniest things I have ever seen in a movie.The moment when the Creeper loses an eye. When he then attempts to sight the spear at the girl running away and realizes he has to sight on the other side because of the missing eye is where things descended into the deepest farce. That was SO funny I was barely able to breathe.When the girl realizes the Creeper's spear just grazed her and she is feeling around on top of her head for the missing hair. Just priceless.Why are Tubbs and Tashtego always shouting at eachother? I suspect it was a desperate attempt to inject some much needed drama into the proceedings.The Creeper's severed hand in a flowerpot. The B movie moments just keep on coming.I could go on, and on, and on...On the acting front it was a disaster.Gabrielle Haugh was a waste of oxygen - I mean, there was just...nothing.Meg Foster was the scariest thing in the movie.On the plus side. I think Stan Shaw and Brandon Smith did their best with their script. Was this movie one big spoof?

Almost 15 years later, a new part of one of the scariest horror films, Jeepers Creepers, has been released. Victor Salva, the director of this creation, delayed the third part for a very long time, they say that due to personal circumstances. The third part takes place between the first and the second, which is a little strange.The plot is that the winged monster returns every 23rd spring, dissecting on his rusty truck and terrifying all living things. It is in this part of Jeepers Creepers that they will show in all its glory, it will appear before the audience in daylight, a grin, a look, gestures, all this can be considered. The truck has also undergone changes, in general, you will see everything for yourself.In the center of the plot is a young girl Eddie, who lives on a farm with her grandmother, the woman suffers from mental disorders, her main goal is to save her granddaughter and take revenge on the clawed monster.A group of people are trying to confront Jeepers Creepers, how will the battle end?The third part does not reach the first and second parts, I still wanted more horror, but in general I liked the film, and perhaps those who were in the subject and followed the story will like it. I was very pleased with the acting. There are practically no moments when they do not play out or overplay. Everything will be here, intrigue, confusing meaning, a logical plot and a very unexpected ending. My rating is 10 stars. It is up to you to decide whether or not to go to the cinema, the film can already be found on the Internet. I recommend Jeepers Creepers Part 3 to watch.
I loved part 1 and 2. I was eagerly waiting for 3rd installment and seems like they should not continue with the movie if they wanted to make a worst movie like this.

reviews.review_title: Jeepers Creepers 3 is a surprise return!
reviews.content: Part 1, the Creeper makes an example of his victims. I know that wasn't very nice! But it really is true. This Thing is an IT, he's a demon of some kind. Part 2, the Creeper is onto his next batch of victims and never lets up! And now 14 years later (never too late), Part 3 brings the Creeper back to the old town to cause some, damage. Gore is there. Scares are there. And just overall good cinematography and cool scenes. Also, his BEATNGU truck is a character of it's own! Go see this!
1 & 2 were good. And now they have messed it up. Not scary at all..

reviews.review_title: LOL!!! hey what were we really expecting???
reviews.content:
"Sorry, we will make the movie you wanted to see next time." Can pretty much sum up this entire film. The fear and dread in the first 2 were what made them both so iconic and classics, Well at least the first one anyways.
This has nothing to do with being against Victor, and I wanted to say that the camera work, editing and choice of cinematography was great. But damn, why make a choice to slow down the pacing and focus on these one dimensional characters with hardly any interesting backstory? Another thing.. they could've saved up a big budget to have good amount of nighttime scenes. The big problem is, there was nothing to fear.. everything about the creeper felt comical, comedic and flat. No explanations, lack of action, laughable use of CGI, cheap/plastic props. The twist or if you even wanna call it a twist.. nah don't even get me started. Lastly, since when did the creeper have this equipment to make these CGI booby traps???...
I'm saying that half these sequels that come out on a daily basis lack action, story and a habit of rehashing the plot.
If you wanna have some good laughs, watch it. You might be surprised how quickly the franchise changes tones. It really hurts to say that too.

Jeepers Creepers 3 falls short of being a good movie. The unnecessary romance subplot and the inclusion of plots that go nowhere, such as the random hand, contributed to the film's lack of coherence and focus. Additionally, the film's special effects were not up to par, which detracted from the overall viewing experience. I felt like the story did too much to try and rewrite the rules that had already been established. We know the Creeper won't die since it's before the second movie, so the only investment was the plot about how the hand gives the characters special knowledge. However, the only thing we learn is that it's "ancient." But many could have inferred that already. Therefore, it's a useless plot line. Given these issues, it's better to watch any other movie instead of wasting time on Jeepers Creepers 3.

There will be spoilers but still it's not even worth watching this movie. After 14 years since the last movie, witch a lot of people thought was s$%t, I kind of liked it, it was far from good and far from the first one but still very enjoyable. But oh my god does this one crap all over it. What surprises me is that it's the original director who promised us a backstory and a final explanation for the Creeper. Yeah you won't get it. You'll be teased till the end and nothing will be explained. You'll get a cameo at the end and a pretty cheesy one and really cringe worthy. My god and the visuals the damn CGI, it looked far better in 2001. Just look at the gap 2001-2017. Imagine that let it sink in. And they ruined the main antagonist by giving him a new stylish red shirt...what? I can get past that if he was frightening here or at least intimidating, but I didn't flinch. Use of pointless CGI, where you can use practical effects is just laughable. I mean if it was good CGI i can get over it but this looks like TV series quality. Some TV shows have much better visual effects...actually a lot of them. The acting...just...some is good but...just I can't even. And get the best part...the story takes place between the first two movies. Am not joking. What a twist -_-... Some shots are just plain good, nothing more, just average and music is also that average but with everything else and the lies about what we were gonna get it can't go higher then 1/10. It doesn't deserve a higher score, just a shame.

Terrible CG, effects barely worthy of 90s TV shows.Bad acting, crap plot. Horrible effects. I cannot think of a movie this bad that was not intentionally bad. Youtube short clips from individual people in university are better then this.

Kinda a letdown after waiting so long and nothing was resolved.. part 4 better be worth it. Felt the plot was dumb and only the last scene was the best. The cgi was kinda bad at some parts. Acting was terrible in some ways also but what do we expect from a horror flick i guess. Lets hope part 4 brings this series to justice!

Was able to watch on the 26th...movie was awesome the creeper was in rare form did all and more of what u wanted he is definitely one of the scariest monsters to b after u if he wants u..only thing wish was longer would not mind seeing again when they re release on the 4th...dont b swayed by any.low reviews if u like one especially 2 there's no way u couldn't like this movie....really hope they make a 4th installment

reviews.review_title: A lousy follow up to the first two
reviews.content: I'll be brief: Bad acting, bad cgi, bad acting, lame over the top weaponry, and bad acting. Characters yelling at each other is no substitute for a story. It was so bad I didn't even finish watching it. Not even the type of bad that is accidentally funny, just bad. The first movie was good, the second was OK, and this one is junk. Save your time and skip it.

I waited 14 years for this? Complete garbage.Shot mostly during daylight hours with some of the worst CGI I've ever seen. CGI is on par with most movies shown on SYFY.This dumpster fire will air on SYFY on November 18th and that's exactly where it belongs,with the other garbage.The creeper deserved better than this!

All jc fans were waiting this sequel since years but now producers come up with this movie. I still can't believe. How they can make that weak movie. Nothing connect with first 2 films like a Saturday morning teenage scary movie. I'm so sad and disappointed. I think we will keep watching first 2 ones and think that this movie never exist

reviews.review_title: Disappointing but still a good film
reviews.content: Much like some, I was disappointed when watching this film as I was expecting a continuation from Jeepers Creepers 2 with Ray Wise at least returning in part. I enjoyed Jeepers Creepers 2 more than the first as it had a bit more action, humor and gave the Creeper more character. After watching the new JC: Reborn last night in cinemas and rewatching JC3 right now, it does not deserve a low rating that it has received. This film does deliver; good story, acting and ties together 1&2 well whilst setting up the next film quite well. It is sad to say that we may never see a worthy conclusion due to controversy surrounding Victor Salva. By no means should this controversy surround such a great franchise.

T H I S is the real horror movie.It's not some modern shit with lots of effects like movies novadays.I'm fan of Victor Salva's work,my favourite is Clownhouse.People today watch horrors with same stories over and over.Like ooohh the curtain is moving oooh the sound of the doors opening is scary ooohh.I mean really? 10/10

Just another example of Hollywood taking a perfectly good story line and destroying it with the third movie. They didn't follow the story line from the last two. They made their own story and it's more of a poor reboot rather than a 3rd

No details on its origan... No original humor like it had before poorly sown and they couldn't even get the kids mane at the beginning right. Wasn't jerry was darry. Butheads. not any were as gory or bloody as the 1st 2 films. I honestly can't say whether they should make another movie, but if they do please have someone else write and direct it , with the damn origan story. What the hell is this thing???!!
Bad acting, ridiculous plot special effects from the late 70's...nothing else to say!

Wow what a let down I've been looking forward to this movie for years and what I got was shotty acting and unlike the previous two films was not scary at all, the creeper was the only good thing about it. After watching this i officially quit watching any movies ever again

I wanted to like this so bad and even ignored the horrendous reviews, however they were mostly correct. The acting was atrocious and the plot holes were plentiful. Secondly having it set between films one and two could have really worked in its favor. Also, the Creeper was creepy, (those signature head tilts) although cheap looking at times. From a technical aspect, the lighting was very well done. Also, the sense of depth from the lenses that were used were beautiful. Perhaps that is were all of the budget went?

reviews.review_title: The Movie that never should have been made.
reviews.content:
This movie must be one of the worst movies ever made.

and i do feel sorry for everyone who baught a copy of this crap.This movie doesn't derserve your precious time... the Director should be very Ashamed.

Okay so I hardly write reviews but I just had to on this one. First I am a huge huge fan of the Jeepers Creepers franchise. I even went to see the first one in theaters-definitely telling my age*sighs* but what I loved about it was how it was an original horror story and you were actually genuinely scared crazy. What it did to me was make me imagine what if I was in that town or on that school bus what would I do?With that said Jeepers Creeper 3 took all that feeling away. I will start with the positives first. I loved the scenic views and how bright and colorful the film was-different from the first two which were dark. The motorcycle scene was great! Meg Foster was a scene stealer with those eyes in some scenes-get to that later.That BEATNGU old truck had its own bells and whistles this time around-I like that! Getting to see Gina Phillips was great too possibly leading to 4?Now for the bad. So what's up with the main actress? Did she not want to be there? It looked like she was being forced or something. Not believable at ALL! OMG what happened to the Creeper? He looked like Jason Stathum with a mask on- not creepy like the first 2 but seriously jacked?? The CGI, soooo bad. One part mainly but I won't give that away but was that supposed to be the epic showdown??? Sometimes to me it looked and felt like Meg Foster was acting in another movie, overly dramatic and over acting. Questions in regards to Creepers origin left open, ending sucks- I know it should have led into 2 but a jump scare something at least? Just not what I was expecting after waiting all these years and then just releasing for only 2 days, I expected more. Way more.

I kinda tired to see how writer and directors (the same guy in case of Jeepers Creepers) think his spectators as idiots. This is creates a sense of great deception: «Let's get some profit with the well know title and the story we created before with out any effort».Jeepers Creepers 3 is terrible in its irrationality. The monster don't even try to hide, he leaves witnesses alive when he killed everyone who could see him in the first movie. There is a job for army and specops after the whole police department saw him and kept him on the aim not a farmers and local police.No logic in the script at all especially for the people who have not seen the previous movies (15 years have passed). There is nothing to see except of the monster (but we saw him already). Don't spent your time for it.

The scene in the first Jeepers Creepers movie when the two kids were investigating the drain pipe at the beginning of the movie, scared the crap out of me. Jeepers Creepers 2 wasn't as good but still had some scary moments in it. Jeepers Creepers 3 was a disappointment.J.C. - 3 was severely lacking any true scary moments, with the acting in some cases being sub-par. The police Sgt. Davis Tubbs had some of the worse lines in the entire movie. Not sure if it was due too bad writing, bad directing, bad acting, or all three. When the police Sgt. did speak, he screamed most of his lines.The other blaring thing on this character was his hair. In real life, Brandon Smith who played police Sgt. Tubbs has very little hair, but someone decided his character needed a military style tall crew cut that screamed DYED TOUPEE. Sadly, every time he was on screen, all I could see was the toupee.The other thing that shocked me was how actress Meg Foster who played Gaylen Brandon looked in the movie. Meg Foster has been acting since the early 60's and with her amazing blue eyes, she was a stunningly beautiful actress. Unfortunately, time has not been kind to her. Like many actors, Meg Foster was a heavy, long-term smoker, destroying her looks. The way Meg Foster looked in this movie, compared too how I remember her looking when she was younger, was very distracting. There was only some color makeup around her eyes, the rest of her appearance was due to years of smoking. Very sad.As in the first two Jeepers Creeper movies, they tried to kill the creature and J.C. - 3 was no different. There was a scene in the movie where they placed a large rotary type Gatling gun in the back of a pick-up truck that one of the actors called a 20mm canon as he loaded 50 cal. ammo in it which is only 13mm. ANYONE with even the slightest knowledge of weapons would know that was the wrong ammo. Even with no knowledge of weapons, you could see the size difference between the ammo and the barrels on the weapon, plus when fired, the barrels didn't rotate like a rotary Gatling type gun would do. Sometimes the little things can make or break a movie.Overall, I was very disappointed in J.C. - 3

reviews.review_title: What the f* is this film about or ... jesus what an arse of a film.
reviews.content: The over the top facial expressions, the sound effects every 5 minutes, the extremely cheesy and hilarious dialogue. The CGI that looked to be made by someone editing it with their feet. The 500 different stories to follow for each character even though all of them are pure man Tits. That one slow motion scene that you'd swear lasted for 45 minutes.This is one of the funniest movies I've ever seen in my life. Considering the first two movies was fantastic horror, and the 14 year gap .... that is between 1 and 2, rather than a sequel from the end of 2, when the man who knew how to kill it became old and waited looking at its corpse awaiting for it to again rise (which he said should be any day now) you'd of expected with all those years of making the movie it would be a big bang ending to the series. In the movie there is a good few stories and none are at all interesting to give a shit. One old woman gets flashbacks and stuff from her dead son that was killed by the creeper, there is biker teens and one is your typical cliché asshole but that leads to nothing, one is a nerdy dude that fancies the ... main character? Girl, but it leads to nothing. One was from the first movie and you don't give a bollocks about him because he's ... not a good actor and a boring character. One scene even randonly killed off a ... main actor I suppose you could call it, out of nowhere in a scene that didn't even involve the damn creeper. It was like a comedy sketch. The girl owns a horse and her mum wants to sell it because they've hardly any money but she loves it and that's about that. The money issues story is over before it started, it meant piss all.We still don't know where this creature came from or why he does what he does or what the hand in the film means (yeah some random hand that does something to people that was never explained and didn't really do much to them anyway) holy fuck what the hell is this film about. I genuinely thought I lost some brain cells because I found myself staring at the TV like I was being brain washed by the season of the witch. Funny ending is that the second ended in the old man waiting for it to rise again which would take a few days. Yet the third flm, which takes place before the second film has the girl from the FIRST film telling he creeper to come get her, yet she isn't in the second so it obviously killed her haha my god. However, drink beer on a weekend and watch this and you'll have a good time.

reviews.review_title: Good cop drama if it wasn't for the oversized bat with questionable sartorial taste
reviews.content: Everybody else already said that this is a really bad addition to the JC franchise - pastiche acting & lame dialogue, weird story line placement, disappointing CGI, too many plot lines with no clear structure of the story etc. Additionally, I would like to point out that this is an utter sausage fest. It only just passes the Bechdel test because two of the three female characters talk about not having enough money to buy hay - for a male horse, though... To top it off, there is also a damsel in distress that needs saving. How is it possible to make a movie in 2017 and still use female characters only as props? This is even more emphasised by the outlandish behaviour of all of the male leads. (Plural, since the director could apparently not commit to one.) There were so many scenes where the actors seemed to have forgotten how to "human" and act and behave according to what the story required (e.g. a threat of danger should make characters run to their cars like they mean it and express believable urgency or fear; if you have a clear line to take a shot at the villain, you shoot at the villain and don't just soulfully stare into their eyes). I sometimes got the impression the director would have preferred to shoot a comical remake of Platoon instead of JP3. At least then the slow-mo battle action, over-the-top heroism and macho one-liners wouldn't have felt so out of place.And we still don't know more about the Creeper! He got so much screen time but no backstory to speak off and in the end, I was sick of seeing so much off him and would have preferred for him to keep lurking in the shadows instead. More of the Creeper doesn't make for a creepier movie. My heart is weeping for all the wasted potential and the two hours of my life that I just wasted.
Still gobsmacked at what I've just witnessed!!! Worst movie I've seen in years !!! Dreadful acting dreadful CGI ... doesn't compare to the first 2 movies. Don't bother watching you will hate it

Now i know it symbolized many ill begotten and evil things associated with the creature. I simply found it far to distracting as the shirt itself was the at the center of the creature and the center focal point. If they wanted to pull off the red symbolizes evil they could have gone with a much smaller article of clothing. it was a poor choice.the ending. He gets on the same bus that is attacked. yet, in the movie following this one on the same time line no one on this bud (assuming buddy is on it) knows whats going on? i mean this is the worst continuity plot whole ever and it has ruined a great cheesy horror series for me.

So a bunch of people touch it and all they find out is that it gets to eat every 23 years. WE ALREADY KNEW THAT !!! From the first film even !So we find out nothing about it. reviews.review_title: Real Life Scary: As in you'll really want to get the 1 hr and 40 mins. of your life back after watching this
reviews.content: This movie is the embodiment of law of diminishing returns especially on sequels. I loved the 1st installment and even did not entirely hate the 2nd one, but this totally ruined it for me when it's supposed to cap off the entire franchise.Characters are so annoying (more than your usual horror film characters) in that it had too many unnecessary supporting characters which got a bit confusing since there was an attempt to give each of them purpose but were taken out in the most nonsensical fashion. Not even from the monster itself.The Creeper who is actually part of my top-10 scary-ass movie monsters was reduced to a mere slasher villain that so happens to have wings and could fly. Pathetic more than scary was the end result.The scenes were also badly cut. There were few instances when dialogues weren't even finished yet then suddenly transitions over to the next scene which seems disconnected from one another.And the main characters were so lame that I was actually rooting for the Creeper to kill them all in the middle of the movie just to get it over and done with.Bottomline: avoid at all cost.

reviews.review_title: Hard core fans WILL be disappointed, watch only if you have no expectations.
reviews.content: This 3rd installment appeared on a network premiere on the Horror Channel, so I thought I would give it a shot. Having already read the terrible reviews beforehand, I went into this movie with not many expectations whatsoever. The story takes place inbetween the first two Jeepers Creepers movies, which I found to be a strange concept, flawed even. However, saying that there's enough material to keep the viewer entertained. For instance, there's plenty of gore for horror fans and Stan Shaw as the Sheriff makes as an interesting character. A lot of the effects look a bit cheap, it appears like this time around they lacked the budget of the other two movies. The Creeper makeup itself though is still on par with the other movies, and he looks as menacing as ever. Personally, I would have loved a Jeepers Creepers movie with a bit more to the origins of the Creeper, a full story to how he became if you like. That would have been a much better concept.All in all, I don't find it as displeasing like others who have reviewed this title. It's one of the those movies you would watch once on a Saturday night with pizza and a few beers. It's mildly entertaining, doesn't require much thinking, and is easily forgettable. Hard core fans of the original movies will be disappointed though, so watch only if you don't have any huge expectations.

reviews.review_title: Awesome, unfinished, hope for a fourth
reviews.content: A lot of people who are giving this low stars are because they did not understand/were not actual fans of the first two movies. This movie combined the first two, and made everything make complete sense;also, revealed a perfect open door for a fourth completely re-imagined (23 years later). The first movie nor the second ever revealed that they were two separate times when the creature was there, the third made it clear that it was all within the same time. So yes, technically the third is between the first and the second Jeepers Creepers, but all within that 23 days of the SAME spring.I enjoyed this one as much as the second, as nothing will ever be as scary as the first for me. They were solid in keeping it as original as the first two movies, making it a perfect sequel in the series. But now I believe they can open doors for the fourth, 23 years later, adding new features as to what the creature can do, how he's adapted, everything. I am a huge fan and hope you will enjoy it as much as i did!

I really enjoy these movies, they have creeped me out in the past. I felt the creeper was a fresh new look on a horror film villain. I was really looking forward to this movie but I was very, very disappointed. I seriously thought this was a made for TV movie with the awful cut scenes and editing. The story was weak and did't make much sense. I wish they would have kept it true to the story line.

I never leave a review on a movie. But this is absolutely the worst movie ever. I couldn't even finish watching it, it was so bad. I stopped halfway through. Whoever produced and directed this movie should be black listed from ever making movies again. I don't get how people gave this movie the OK.

reviews.review_title: At most, this movie should had been called Jeepers Creepers 1½!
reviews.content:
This third movie, takes place between (couple day) time period, between the first and second movies. They should had followed Disney's example like the did with the Lion King, if it's a stupid prequel, set between 2 already established movies, call it the truth, which would had been Jeepers Creepers 1½.
Jeepers Creepers 3, should've been a whole NEW movie, about the return 13 years later! The first Jeepers Creepers, was released in 2001, but the year wasn't disclosed in the movie (to the best of my knowledge). Neither was the year disclosed in the second release either. So the third could, and should had been based around 13 years later, not only because it was released 16 years later, and he's supposed to return every 13 years, for 13 days, but also because Jeepers Creepers "3" just adds technology to his "BEATNGU" truck, a weak victim who essentially gets away from him ALIVE, which directly contradicts the first movie, which states that, "when he finds someone that he likes, there's no escaping him. He'll keep coming for you, until he get what he wants (to eat).
True too, in the second movie, nor the "third", does he even EAT anything, from anyone! The addition of the technology in the third movie, should had been entitled Jeepers Creepers 1½, period!
The first was the best setting! The second movie, added the "creepy" factor, with his smiling at; and taunting his prey! But the third, didn't add anything, but technology to the presetting! The Creepers truck, wasn't even featured in the second movie! And the third, is primarily only about his truck!
However, not in any installment of this movie, is the year disclosed! So making another Jeepers Creepers, needs to be the 13 years later, at least! They can make 2 - 3 movies (apparently), for THAT 13 day period, but it at least needs to pick up, where the second movie left off!
And regardless what people think about Victor Salva, and his past. They can watch the movies, or NOT! This third release, advertises on the covers of both the DVD and Blu-ray releases, that it's the "THEATRICAL EDITION". Is there an Extended, Unrated, and/or Uncut edition to this movie?! It only makes sense that there is, being advertised as the "THEATRICAL EDITION". So why wasn't the alternative version included on the DVD, or at the very least, the Blu-ray?!
If it's in efforts to make people upgrade to "digital" only movies, it was a cheap ploy, as MOST people haven't even upgraded to Blu-rays yet! I still know some older people, who haven't even upgraded to a DVD player yet!
Terrible story, terrible acting....the demon/monster was hilariously awful. Looked like he had been to the gym and was trying to up his style.....so lame.....ugh
Couldn't find where I could add this but how is it the mole on the girls face moves in the secen where she's in the truck

I'm still a bit in shock at how terrible this film is. After loving the first and second film I was saving this for a quiet night and a cold one. I now wish I watched it with my four year old to teach her the principle of true comedy. Everything from the storyline to the amateur CGI rubbish all over the film was a joke. It felt from start to finish like a cheap budget, cutting room floor load of trash that isn't even deserved for the cutting room floor. Don't waste your time as it will only make you hate the original.

It's such a shame, I adored the first and the second movie. They didn't do the franchise justice with this horrible flick. Firstly, the CGI effects aren't that great. They look terrible. Second, the Creeper does nothing, aside from throw some spears and grunts. He flies around and tackles people. Where's the suspense? The action? All of this was prevalent in the first two movies, but seriously lacked in the third one. Netflix added it, thank goodness I didn't waste $9 at a theater. Most of the movie, I spent on my phone, because I lost interest. The only saving grace to this movie, which doesn't say much, was the scene with the teenagers in the woods. That was a decent scene chock full of suspense and drama. Now take that and turn it into a whole movie. The creeper didn't even eat anybody! I'm sincerely disappointed as a fan of the series, this one was subpar and should've been scrapped. I would've gladly waited longer for a better film than this train wreck. They give way to the idea of another movie and it better be far better than this one, otherwise I don't see a point in continuing.

If you enjoyed the first two films, then this really is not the film for you. I can only assume that this was made by people who were doing their respective jobs for the very first time. The best part about this film is that you can make a drinking game from it. Every time someone laughs at the CGI, they have to take a shot. I recommend having an ambulance on standby.

reviews.review_title: Please don't support the convicted child molester directer
reviews.content: The original Jeepers Creepers was one of my all time favorite fun horror movies. I'd been waiting for this third movie to come out just like all the other fans. Last year I learned of the director's- Victor Salva- conviction of child molestation. It's not up for debate, he filmed himself molesting his then young actor in one of his films. He served 15 months in prison. FIFTEEN MONTHS. The system failed this young boy- but we can still hit this monster where it really hurts- his pocket. I refuse to watch this movie and it doesn't look like I'm missing much anyway. As much as I love the first one, I'll never ever watch it again. This little tidbit is also on his IMDb trivia page...can't make this stuff up.

The whole movie was a big waiste of time and the fact that the creeper did not look as realistic in the 1st and 2nd movie this creeper in the 3rd looked like rubber and the movie is so clesay and the there is too much CGI and it was terrible.

reviews.review_title: Worst special effects I have seen in a long time.
reviews.content: Could have made this movie in crayon and it would look better!

Soooo low budget. 
So disappointing. Expecting so much more.

If anyone can offer me any explanation why the the this film was subtitled 'cathedral' it would be greatly appreciated because I can't find the link anywhere?! No reference to a cathedral at all?As a huge JC fan I have been waiting too long for this film! But my lord it was bad, I watched the film around the 15 minutes ago and I can honestly say I can't remember the plot, it was just a mess start to finish, so disappointed!

So I thought Jeepers Creepers 3 was going to be the return of Tricia, seeking justice for her brother, but instead they did some weird filler between the two movies, and saved Tricia's return for the 4th movie if they even make one. So the movie begins at the end of the first movie, by the jail that JP takes Darry. But here's the issue. JP2 gives you the impression that JP2 is 23 years later than JP, but in actually all 3 movies occur in the same 23 days. JP makes his first appearance in 1, then JP 3 take place in between, and at the end of JP3 we see the school bus and are told that the end of JP2 is actually the end of the story. But playing off of JP2, the farmer is sitting in the barn as an old man, waiting for the monster to return. This story line doesn't make any sense. And if Tricia is waiting for the monster, are we to see Tricia as an old women in JP4. This movie seriously might have ruined the whole series all together.

First off, I would like to say I was disappointed by this one. Spoiler! Trish is only a cameo. The characters weren't really memorable so I don't remember any of their names. So, this is supposed to take place during the 23 days the creeper had to feed in 1st and 2nd movie. It was complete bs though. SPOILING THE MOVIE! His truck had all these great add-ons you didn't see in the first Jeepers Creepers. He goes after the people on the bus from the 2nd installment, but doesn't hunt down the old lady and her granddaughter after they got away (end of movie)??? Weren't they still in the same house that the creeper had a break down in front of at the end of the film??? Doesn't make any sense. Also, if you are going to link the 3rd movie to the 2nd in the end, it would of made sense to have a guy resembling the character from 3 know who the creeper was in 2. I know this doesn't really make sense, but the movie was poorly done. Also, there are some characters that disappear at some point of the movie. There's a team hunting down the creeper and most of them DISAPPEAR! They aren't even brought up again or anything. The creeper can smell fear, but he couldn't smell that his victims were still alive in his truck? When is the right time to snack on some body parts? Tell me why at one point of the movie after the creeper ate parts from this guy that hit him with a truck, he looked like Deebo from 'Friday'? The creeper was super strong, but the one guy in the 2nd movie was fighting him off when the creeper was on top of him! Come on guys! Consistency is a must. Without it, you get Jeepers Creepers 3. ALSO, what is the creeper? The old lady claimed she knew what the creeper was from locking hands with his severed hand. We didn't get a flashback or anything to explain his origin. That was such a useless part in the movie. If you don't want to explain stuff, just cut it out. The more bs you have, the more it kills a movie. was waiting for this movie for YEARS and now I hope there isn't another one. This movie did the fans dirty.

This movie is terrible. The first two films were decent but JC3 just does not compare at all. The movie is confusing because it makes no sense. I actually googled the movie while watching to see if I had missed something. JC fans wanted a prequel (origins story) or a story beyond the second film but instead it takes place between 1 and 2. I don't understand the decision to make JC3 the way it was made. It's almost as if they wanted to create a horrible movie. Even if you liked the first two movies, you're not missing much by never watching this movie.

Omg! The director should have NEVER made a 3. This was the dumbest movie. It made me mad because the actors were stupid and so was the plot. It made no sense and whoever wrote the lines should never write again.The decisions that were made in the movie was not realistic at all. Dumbest decisions were made. It deserves enough rating because it was low budget and crap.

reviews.review_title: False advertisement, and terrible acting (even for the Syfy channel)
reviews.content: Those that have seen the rest of the series know that one of the major hooks, is that the "creeper" is a rather mysterious character in the horror film genre. In the first two films, all we really know is that every 23rd spring it gets to eat for 23 days, and that it eats to restore it's body.Enter the third film. The allure of this film, is that supposedly after all these years, light will be shed on the creature. There's a part in the film, where they hold the former hand of "the creeper", which gives the person a vision of it's past, and what it is. However, NONE of this is shared with the audience! IMHO it's a BIG @#$% you to its patrons. Without a doubt, this is nothing more then a ploy to revive a long dead series due to the lack of creativity in movie producers these days, and string along those enjoyed the franchise milking them of their money.The portrayal of the main antagonist is so far off the mark from the rest of the series. Supposedly, the third film takes place chronologically between the first and second film. Odd part is, that elements of the film are so far outside of scope of the picture the series paints. It treats the character almost like an evil good humor ice cream truck driver.The end of the film alludes to one of the characters being on the bus, the main setting, of the second film. Problem is, that if you link one film to another, the character needs to have some idea of what's going on, in order of sequence. That's just terrible storytelling.I for one will not continue to waste time and energy on subsequent films of this franchise, if such horrendous methods are to be considered part of the new norm.

There i was waiting for this movie to be released,i live in Nigeria so i saw this movie a month after its release.it was total crap,it was as if the actors were all imported from 1971.jeepers creepers 1 was good,the 2nd was excellent,but this,this is so so bad.don't see this movie,do not waste your time,use it for something else.this movie was a disgrace to those who worked in the previous movies.
I love Jc, as a kid it was one of the 1st horrors I remember watching, but this third instalment is awful! The story line is weak, no tension and no scares! What a let down after a long wait!
This is probably one of my favorite "so bad is good" movies ever.

reviews.review_title: worst movie I have seen in years
reviews.content:
Back then when the first movie came out, as a kid I watched the movie front to back many times. Though the first movie did have its flaws it was a good horror movie with great suspense and build-up. I am terribly let down by the second movie and even more so by the third,the movie had almost no suspense or anything needed for a good horror/thriller movie.The plot is absolutely terrible and the special effects are laughable.
In conclusion if I had the option to rate this an absolute 0/10 stars and get my time and money back I would. I had more fun watching Birdemic than this because at least the plot and terrible effects made me laugh.

Im really disappointed about this movie. The real JC was more like a flying-brutality killing-monster with wings. In this movie JC is just like a dude with a mask that is running and killing peoples, like a joke.

reviews.review_title: I genuinely feel like I've been mugged.
reviews.content: Hand on heart guys.... please don't waste your precious time watching this mockery of a film. The plot makes no logical sense and you don't learn a single thing about the creeper despite the fact they make a big deal about knowing his origins and what he is. If you want to watch it so you've seen the set then go for it but I promise you will regret it.P.s I've never reviewed a movie before but wanted to make an account purely to try and save you beautiful people some of your well earned chill time.
